dataset.title: APEX beta NW site: hourly soil temperature, soil moisture, air temperature and RH, photosynthetically active radiation (PAR), and rain.

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Integrative Biology University of Guelph
U.S. Geological Survey 345 Middlefield Road, MS 962
Geophysical Institute, 903 Koyukuk Dr.,407A Elvey, University of Alaska Fairbanks

abstract.para: This dataset contains hourly averages of air temperature and RH, soil temperature and moisture, PAR, and rain. This basic environmental data supports the other research that is going on at this site.

section.title: Access to Data
section.para: While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

section.title: Use of data
section.para: Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

section.title: Citing Bonanza Creek LTER Datasets
section.para: It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

section.title: Experimental Design
section.para: These sites were established to provide core soil physical (temp. and moisture) data.

section.title: Methods
section.para: Data at this site are collected using a Campbell CR1000. Air temperature and relative humidity are recorded from a HMP Vaisala probe (HMP45C). Soil temperature is being measured at 2, 5, 10, 25, 50, 100, and 250cm. The temperature probes were made in the lab using type EC95H303W thermistors from Thermometrics, Corp. and EPO-TEK 715 epoxy. The following moisture sensors are used: the Campbell Scientific CS616 sensor. PAR was measured using a quantum sensor (Apogee Instruments, Inc. (model QSO)) mounted onto a leveling plate.

section.title: Sampling Frequency
section.para: scanned every 1 minutes and reported hourly
